page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There is evidence of Romans and Vikings in Sidlesham . A small Roman villa was discovered here but was later covered up again . The greatest change came to the village in 1935 when the Land Settlement Association was set up. This gave small areas of land and houses to unemployed coal miners from Wales and County Durham. These men had to learn how to produce food on their Land and were promised a market for it. They brought their wives and children with them it meant that the village school had to be enlarged and the population grew. In 1983 the L.S.A. finished and the tenants were allowed to buy their holdings. Many are extending their crops and producing melons, peppers, flowers and aubergines.
